```{r pub_data}
publications <- scholar::get_publications(id, sortby = "year", pagesize = 100, flush = TRUE)
publications <- subset(publications, ! journal %in% c("CHEMICAL SENSES","University of Cambridge",""))
authorlist <- publications$author
publications$journal[publications$journal %in% c("BioRxiv","Biorxiv","biorxiv")] <- "bioRxiv"
publications$position <- author_position(authorlist, scholar::get_profile(id)$name)$Position
publications$position[is.na(publications$position)] = 6
publications$IF <- scholar::get_impactfactor(publications$journal, max.distance = 0.05)$ImpactFactor
publications$IF[is.na(publications$IF)] = 0
publications$IF <- round(publications$IF)
publications$author = gsub("AS Bates","**AS Bates**",publications$author)
publications$author = gsub("A Bates","**A Bates**",publications$author)
publications$title = paste0("<a href='","https://scholar.google.com/scholar?oi=bibs&hl=en&cites=",gsub(",.*","",publications$cid), "'>",publications$title,"</a>")
publications$journal <- gsub("Conference","Conf.",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("Current","Curr.",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("communications","Comm.",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("European","Euro.",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("Research","Res.",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("elife","eLife",publications$journal)
publications$journal <- gsub("Journal","J.",publications$journal)

# Bold for first author
first.pubids <- c("mVmsd5A6BfQC", "8k81kl-MbHgC",
                  "Y0pCki6q_DkC", "eQOLeE2rZwMC",
                  "d1gkVwhDpl0C", "hqOjcs7Dif8C",
                  "_FxGoFyzp5QC")

# Add first author papers by title (for cases where pubid might not match)
first_author_titles <- c("Distributed control circuits across a brain-and-cord connectome")
first_by_pubid <- publications$pubid %in% first.pubids
first_by_title <- grepl(paste(first_author_titles, collapse="|"), publications$title, ignore.case = TRUE)
first <- first_by_pubid | first_by_title

publications$position[first] <- 1
publications$author[first] <- gsub("\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*", "<ins>**AS Bates**</ins>",publications$author[first])
publications$author[first] <- gsub("\\*\\*A Bates\\*\\*", "<ins>**A Bates**</ins>",publications$author[first])

# Add obelus (†) for first authorship and double obelus (‡) for corresponding authorship
for(i in 1:nrow(publications)) {
  # Get clean title for matching
  clean_title <- gsub("<.*?>", "", publications$title[i])

  if(grepl("Distributed control circuits across a brain-and-cord connectome", clean_title, ignore.case = TRUE)) {
    # BANC paper: Multiple first authors (AS Bates†‡, JS Phelps†‡, M Kim†, HH Yang†)
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†‡", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("JS Phelps", "JS Phelps†‡", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("M Kim", "M Kim†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("HH Yang", "HH Yang†", publications$author[i])
  } else if(grepl("Neurotransmitter classification from electron microscopy", clean_title, ignore.case = TRUE)) {
    # Neurotransmitter paper: N Eckstein†, AS Bates†
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("N Eckstein", "N Eckstein†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
  } else if(grepl("Information flow, cell types and stereotypy", clean_title, ignore.case = TRUE)) {
    # Schlegel and Bates co-first
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("P Schlegel", "P Schlegel†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
  } else if(grepl("Complete connectomic reconstruction of olfactory projection neurons", clean_title, ignore.case = TRUE)) {
    # Bates and Schlegel co-first
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("P Schlegel", "P Schlegel†", publications$author[i])
  } else if(grepl("The natverse, a versatile toolbox", clean_title, ignore.case = TRUE)) {
    # Bates and Manton co-first
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("JD Manton", "JD Manton†", publications$author[i])
  } else if(first[i]) {
    # Standard first author paper - add † after the underlined name
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*AS Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
    publications$author[i] <- gsub("(<ins>\\*\\*A Bates\\*\\*</ins>)", "\\1†", publications$author[i])
  }
}

publications <- publications[,c("title","author","journal","year","cites", "position","IF")]
publications <- dplyr::arrange(publications, position, dplyr::desc(year))

# Separate out reviews
revs <- c("Systems neuroscience: Auditory processing at synaptic resolution",
          "Neuronal cell types in the fly: single-cell anatomy meets single-cell genomics")
revs <- paste0(revs,collapse="|")
reviews <- subset(publications, grepl(revs,title))
publications <- subset(publications, ! grepl(revs,title))
rownames(reviews) <- 1:nrow(reviews)

# Corrections
corr <- c("Neurotransmitter Classification from Electron Microscopy Images at Synaptic Sites in Drosophila Melanogaster")
publications$journal[publications$title%in%corr] <- "*Accepted at Cell*"
publications$year[publications$title%in%corr] <- "2023"

# Update BANC connectome paper
banc_corr <- grepl("Distributed control circuits across a brain-and-cord connectome", publications$title, ignore.case = TRUE)
publications$journal[banc_corr] <- "bioRxiv, *in review at Nature*"

rownames(publications) <- 1:nrow(publications)

# Get peer reviews
prs <- rorcid::orcid_peer_reviews(asb.id)
plucked_prs <- prs %>%
  purrr::map_dfr(pluck, "group") %>%
  janitor::clean_names() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(last_modified_date_value = anytime::anydate(last_modified_date_value/1000))
peer_reviews <- data.frame()
for(i in 1:length(plucked_prs$peer_review_group)){
  pr.df <- do.call(plyr::rbind.fill,plucked_prs$peer_review_group[[i]]$`peer-review-summary`) %>%
      janitor::clean_names() %>%
      as.data.frame()
  issn <- gsub("issn\\:","",pr.df$review_group_id)
  details <- rcrossref::cr_journals(issn = issn, works = FALSE)
  journals <- data.frame(journal = details$data$title)
  peer_reviews <- plyr::rbind.fill(peer_reviews,journals)
}
peer_reviews <- peer_reviews %>%
  dplyr::mutate(journal=dplyr::case_when(
    journal=="PLoS Computational Biology" ~ "PLoS Comp. Bio.",
    journal=="Nature Communications" ~ "Nature Comm.",
    TRUE ~ journal
  )
  ) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(journal) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(reviews = dplyr::n()) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup() %>%
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(reviews)) %>%
  dplyr::distinct(journal, reviews)

# Add COSYNE abstract reviews
cosyne_reviews <- data.frame(journal = "COSYNE (abstracts)", reviews = 9)
peer_reviews <- dplyr::bind_rows(peer_reviews, cosyne_reviews) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(reviews))

#read_csv(file = "peer_reviews.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
```

```{r data_and_code}
# Load compiled data and code sources
tryCatch({
  data_sources <- read.csv("data_and_code_sources.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

  # Group by type for organized display
  dataverse_sources <- data_sources %>% filter(type == "dataverse")
  github_sources <- data_sources %>% filter(type == "github")
  zenodo_sources <- data_sources %>% filter(type == "zenodo")

  # Display Harvard Dataverse
  if (nrow(dataverse_sources) > 0) {
    for(i in 1:nrow(dataverse_sources)) {
      ds <- dataverse_sources[i, ]

      cat("### Public Dataset: ", ds$title, "\n\n")
      cat(ds$organization, "\n\n")
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")  # For the location field
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")  # For the timeline field

      cat("- DOI: [", ds$doi, "](https://doi.org/", ds$doi, ")\n", sep = "")
      if (!is.na(ds$description) && ds$description != "") {
        cat("- ", ds$description, "\n", sep = "")
      }
      cat("\n")
    }
  }

  # Display GitHub projects by organization
  if (nrow(github_sources) > 0) {
    # Group by organization
    orgs <- unique(github_sources$organization)
    for (org in orgs) {
      org_repos <- github_sources %>% filter(organization == org) %>% arrange(desc(stars))

      cat("### Open Source Contributions: ", org, "\n\n")
      cat("GitHub Organization\n\n")
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")

      cat("- ", nrow(org_repos), " repositories as contributor\n", sep = "")

      # Show download statistics if available
      repos_with_downloads <- org_repos %>%
        filter(!is.na(downloads) & downloads > 0) %>%
        arrange(desc(downloads))

      if (nrow(repos_with_downloads) > 0) {
        cat("- Top downloads: ")
        download_info <- sapply(1:nrow(repos_with_downloads), function(i) {
          repo <- repos_with_downloads[i, ]
          paste0(repo$title, " (", format(repo$downloads, big.mark = ","), ")")
        })
        cat(paste(download_info, collapse = ", "))
        cat("\n")
      }

      # Show all repositories
      cat("- Projects: ")
      repo_links <- sapply(1:nrow(org_repos), function(i) {
        repo <- org_repos[i, ]
        paste0("[", repo$title, "](", repo$url, ")")
      })
      cat(paste(repo_links, collapse = ", "))
      cat("\n\n")
    }
  }

  # Display Zenodo projects
  if (nrow(zenodo_sources) > 0) {
    for(i in 1:nrow(zenodo_sources)) {
      zs <- zenodo_sources[i, ]

      cat("### Zenodo Dataset: ", zs$title, "\n\n")
      cat("Zenodo\n\n")
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")
      cat("N/A", "\n\n")

      cat("- DOI: [", zs$doi, "](https://doi.org/", zs$doi, ")\n", sep = "")
      if (!is.na(zs$downloads) && zs$downloads > 0) {
        cat("- Downloads: ", format(zs$downloads, big.mark = ","), "\n", sep = "")
      }
      cat("\n")
    }
  }

}, error = function(e) {
  cat("### Data and Code Resources\n\n")
  cat("GitHub\n\n")
  cat("N/A\n\n")
  cat("N/A\n\n")
  cat("- See [GitHub profile](https://github.com/alexanderbates) for open source contributions\n\n")
})
```
